title: Transactions not broadcasting correctly on private network
body:
#### System information

Geth Version: `1.4.10-stable-5f55d95a`
OS & Version: OSX 10.11.6 / Redhat Linux 6.2
#### Expected behaviour

I have created two private chain nodes on my network and have added them as peers. I've verified using `admin.peers` on both nodes. One of my nodes is mining the other is just listening and syncing blocks.

I am attempting a simple `sendTransaction()` (as I've done many times before on both the testnet and mainnet chains) and would expect that the transaction broadcasts to the mining node and is collected into the next block.
#### Actual behaviour

When the non-mining node attempts a `sendTransaction()`, the tx does not correctly broadcast and sits in pending state in the txpool.
#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

On the same network (different VMs) start two geth nodes.
Mining node (OSX): `geth --datadir /Users/path/to/datadir --networkid 1900 --rpc --mine --minerthreads=1 --autodag --etherbase "0x59744f92afd033b4c9747bcee9198f13b59b50a7" --bootnodes enode://5d65ef6a59cdd283e40d0d861c856359a340811df3f2b43fcb788d2da7b06af322204821e543620d93250403823a48605714ade6091d5cb4766fb5227c5ae3ff@10.172.101.94:30303 console`

Non-mining node (RHEL Linux): `geth --datadir /home/shared/blockchain/datadir --networkid 1900 --rpc --etherbase "0x5782514f6d173cdac71c1ac56c6eb836b97df850" console 2> geth.log`

Validate that nodes are connected (`admin.peers`) and verify that blocks are correctly syncing from miner node (`eth.blockNumber` same results on both)

on the non-mining node: unlock coinbase account and sendTransaction to any address

```
eth.sendTransaction({from:eth.coinbase,to:eth.accounts[1],value:web3.toWei(2)})
```
#### Backtrace

Non-mining node verbose logs:

